title: Explosion rocks Liverpool
text: Liverpool explosion: Reports of two buildings destroyed by suspected gas blast Jamie Seidel, agencies, News Corp Australia Network March 26, 2017 9:41am BREAKING: A large explosion has shocked the British city of Liverpool awake, with reports of two buildings having collapsed. The explosion happened in the Wirral area of Merseyside, alongside the river Mersey. media_camera Early location of gas explosion in Liverpool Initial reports from the scene report the streets littered with debris and bricks. Unconfirmed reports centre the explosion at a petrol station near Bebbington station. Heavy scenes from over the water in new ferry pic.twitter.com/n98gh5FdbZ Merseyside Fire Services have told local media that the blast has devastated an area some 50 meters by 40 meters.. “They have collapsed in a suspected explosion due to a gas leak,” a fire spokeswoman said. There are reports of injuries. Special rescue teams have been called for. The explosion shook the ground and sent a huge plume of smoke and dust into the sky. Explosion at Dance studio in New Ferry Birkenhead: https://t.co/XrjDyiT5OQ via @YouTube — UK News in Pictures (@uknip247) March 25, 2017 Looks like explosion on Wirral was in New Ferry near a dance school. Hope everyone is safe #wirral pic.twitter.com/IIldFJbse7 — Phil Edwards (@Live_for_Films) March 25, 2017 Two buildings destroyed by huge 'gas blast' in Wirral https://t.co/l4mTbJ3DFC pic.twitter.com/bnF5HA7vFO — ITV News (@itvnews) March 25, 2017 MORE TO COME Originally published as Explosion rocks Liverpool Most viewed
